Package com.tversity.sdk.android

Provides Classes and Interfaces that allow "Flinging" of media to target devices.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
AirFlinger.IBrowseChildrenCallback This interface defines a callback function for browse server command
AirFlinger.ICommandCallback Provides an interface to receive a callback after an asynchronous command was performed.
AirFlinger.IEventCallback This interface defines callback functions that receive status change notifications.
AirFlinger.ILogCallback This interface defines a callback function to SDK logging
AirFlinger.IPositionEventCallback This interface defines callback functions for position information events
AirFlinger.IPositionInfoCallback Provides an interface to receive a callback after an asynchronous call to get player position info
AirFlinger.IVolumeLevelCallback This interface defines a callback function for get volume level command
IAFDevice This interface provides common methods for all device types
IAFDirChildren This interface is returned by IAFServer.browseChildren(java.lang.String, int, int, java.lang.Object, com.tversity.sdk.android.AirFlinger.IBrowseChildrenCallback) through the AirFlinger.IBrowseChildrenCallback interface
IAFMediaBrowse This interface is returned by getLocalMedia(com.tversity.sdk.android.IAFMediaClasses.EntryType, boolean) It provides functionality to browse through a tree of media items
IAFMediaClasses This interface defines interfaces for all available media items
IAFMediaClasses.IDirectory Defines interface for a directory entry
IAFMediaClasses.IEntry Defines common interface for any entry
IAFMediaClasses.IFile Defines a common interface for a file entry
IAFMediaClasses.IResource Defines interface for a file entry resources
IAFPlayer This interface provides access and control to player devices
IAFServer This interface provides access and control to server devices
IAirFlinger This interface provides the main SDK functionality Using this interface you should initialize and terminate the SDK and get access to available devices
 

Class Summary
AirFlinger This class is the entry point to the AirFlinger SDK.
 

Enum Summary
AirFlinger.CommandResult Defines the possible result values of commands sent to devices.
AirFlinger.DeviceStatus Defines the possible statuses a device can have.
AirFlinger.DeviceType Defines the possible types of devices.
IAFMediaClasses.EntryType Defines the possible entry types in a media files tree.
 

Exception Summary
AirFlinger.AirFlingerException Parent class of all SDK exceptions
AirFlinger.CommandCancelledException Indicates that the AirFlinger SDK is shutting down before the command was processed
AirFlinger.CommandFailedException Indicates that the command sent to the device has failed
AirFlinger.DeviceOfflinenException Indicates that the device you were trying to access is offline
AirFlinger.InitializationException Indicates that the AirFlinger SDK failed to initialize.
AirFlinger.InvalidCommandException Indicates that the device does not support the requested command
AirFlinger.InvalidDeviceException Indicates that no device is known with the id specified
AirFlinger.InvalidParamException Indicates that an invalid parameter was sent
AirFlinger.ServiceDisconnectedException Indicates that the AirFlinger SDK service has disconnected from the application
AirFlinger.SuccessException Indicates that an operation was completed successfully
AirFlinger.UnknownErrorException Indicates that an unknown error occurred
 

Package com.tversity.sdk.android Description

Provides Classes and Interfaces that allow "Flinging" of media to target devices.

The main class is AirFlinger. It should never be instantiated directly but instead AirFlinger.get(), which returns an IAirFlinger interface, should be called to obtain the interface.

IAirFlinger.init() should be called before starting to use AirFlinger. IAirFlinger.terminate() should be called during shutdown for cleanup.

All methods are thread safe and can be called from any thread. However, some methods require the user to provide a callback. Those methods require communicating with devices on the network and are therefore asynchronous by nature.
Important: regardless of the thread that an AirFlinger method was called in, AirFlinger callbacks are always returned in the GUI thread. It is therefore safe to access the GUI from within the callbacks. However, any access to data that other threads access must be synchronized by the API user and are out of scope of AirFlinger.
